com.example.survivorbuddy4mobile

Class BuddyAudioServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.survivorbuddy4mobile.BuddyAudioServer

  • public class BuddyAudioServer
extends java.lang.Object
    A TCP server which receives data from client and writes it to a PipedOutputStream

    • Method Detail

      • getPipe

        public java.io.PipedInputStream getPipe()
        Wrapper to provides a PipedOutputStream which is paired to the writePipe
        Returns:
        PipedInputStream paired to a PipedOutputStream to which incoming data of the server is written

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the server, receives the chunk size from client which denotes the size of all other packets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receiveDataLoop

        public void receiveDataLoop()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the reception of bytes in a loop, stops when receive data returns false or server encounters an error/is stopped
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receiveData

        public boolean receiveData()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads number of bites which was specified by client. Writes those bytes to a PipedOutputStream
        Returns:
        boolean, true if read on socket was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        Stops the server. Does not notify client. Client is expected to handle disconnection
